data.text: Many have sinned for a thing indifferent;
A nail will stick fast between the joinings of stones;
Unless a man  hold on diligently in the fear of the Lord,
In the shaking of a sieve, the refuse remaineth;
The furnace will prove the potterâ€™s vessels;
The fruit of a tree declareth the husbandry thereof;
Praise no man before thou hearest him  reason;
If thou followest righteousness, thou shalt obtain her,
Birds will resort unto their like;
The lion lieth in wait for prey;
The discourse of a godly man is always wisdom:
Among men void of understanding observe the opportunity;
The discourse of fools is an offence;
The talk of a man of many oaths will make the hair stand upright;
The strife of the proud is a shedding of blood;
He that revealeth secrets destroyeth credit,
Love a friend, and keep faith with him:
For as a man hath destroyed his enemy,
And as a bird which thou hast loosed out of thy hand,
Pursue him not, for he is gone far away,
For a wound may be bound up, and after reviling there may be a reconcilement;
One that winketh with the eye contriveth evil things;
When thou art present, he will speak sweetly,
I have hated many things, but nothing like him;
One that casteth a stone on high casteth it on his own head;
He that diggeth a pit shall fall into it;
He that doeth evil things, they shall roll upon him,
Mockery and reproach are from the haughty;
They that rejoice at the fall of the godly shall be taken in a snare;
Wrath and anger, these also are abominations;
